channel.title: Portforwarding/running a server fail
channel.description:
Mmk. Now I'm trying to run a server on my labtop. I downloaded the server and all. I've successfully portforwarded a rsps on my other xp labtop once upon a time. Anyways this computer is Windows 7. I set a static ip, unblocked the port from my mcafee firewall and lastly I portforwarded.
[IMG]http://i53.tinypic.com/2h7gk9e.png[/img] Is my portforward proof. This is my firewall [IMG]http://i53.tinypic.com/29cl2r9.png[/img]
I've run out of thoughts. I used to run a different server recently(non rsps) and it worked just fine.
Help is appreciated! Thanks and I hope you can help me resolve this!

item.title: Portforwarding/running a server fail
item.dc:creator: @immortaliyftw immortaliyftw
item.description:
@immortaliyftw wrote:

I’m not stupid it has to deal with my portforwarding or something apparently. I can use teamviewer for anyone that knows wth they are doing

item.title: Portforwarding/running a server fail
item.dc:creator: @X_Entinity_X X Entinity X
item.description:
@X_Entinity_X wrote:

Do you have No-ip DUC, if not download it, then say if you want your server to be called “FtwScape” update DNS hosts, then add the server Ip into Client & Source files.

If not, try this www.portforward.com

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding/running a server fail
item.dc:creator: @erde0 erde0
item.description:
@erde0 wrote:

What source are you using? PI or Delta?

If you’re using PI try portforwarding port 5555

My friend also has problems with portforwarding with LinkSys, even I couldnt get it to work. I’ve no idea what’s wrong with it though.

Read full topic
